1.text: Know you the time when the wild goats of the rock bring forth? or can you mark when the hinds do calve?

2.text: Can you number the months that they fulfill? or know you the time when they bring forth?

3.text: They bow themselves, they bring forth their young ones, they cast out their sorrows.

4.text: Their young ones are in good liking, they grow up with corn; they go forth, and return not to them.

5.text: Who has sent out the wild ass free? or who has loosed the bands of the wild ass?

6.text: Whose house I have made the wilderness, and the barren land his dwellings.

7.text: He scorns the multitude of the city, neither regards he the crying of the driver.

8.text: The range of the mountains is his pasture, and he searches after every green thing.

9.text: Will the unicorn be willing to serve you, or abide by your crib?

10.text: Can you bind the unicorn with his band in the furrow? or will he harrow the valleys after you?

11.text: Will you trust him, because his strength is great? or will you leave your labor to him?

12.text: Will you believe him, that he will bring home your seed, and gather it into your barn?

13.text: Gave you the goodly wings to the peacocks? or wings and feathers to the ostrich?

14.text: Which leaves her eggs in the earth, and warms them in dust,

15.text: And forgets that the foot may crush them, or that the wild beast may break them.

16.text: She is hardened against her young ones, as though they were not herâ€™s: her labor is in vain without fear;

17.text: Because God has deprived her of wisdom, neither has he imparted to her understanding.

18.text: What time she lifts up herself on high, she scorns the horse and his rider.

19.text: Have you given the horse strength? have you clothed his neck with thunder?

20.text: Can you make him afraid as a grasshopper? the glory of his nostrils is terrible.

21.text: He paws in the valley, and rejoices in his strength: he goes on to meet the armed men.

22.text: He mocks at fear, and is not affrighted; neither turns he back from the sword.

23.text: The quiver rattles against him, the glittering spear and the shield.

24.text: He swallows the ground with fierceness and rage: neither believes he that it is the sound of the trumpet.

25.text: He said among the trumpets, Ha, ha; and he smells the battle afar off, the thunder of the captains, and the shouting.

26.text: Does the hawk fly by your wisdom, and stretch her wings toward the south?

27.text: Does the eagle mount up at your command, and make her nest on high?

28.text: She dwells and stays on the rock, on the crag of the rock, and the strong place.

29.text: From there she seeks the prey, and her eyes behold afar off.

30.text: Her young ones also suck up blood: and where the slain are, there is she.
